column4: I installed Code::blocks but when I try to open it it says starting Code::blocks but then the window disappears. What's wrong?
Nobody knows?
What is wrong with my Code::blocks?
run it from the command line and see if it outputs an error. just telling us it quits is useless
Ok.
Where would I find the executable? Haha. Where is Linux's "Program Files".
if you type "echo $PATH" itll answer the "where's Program Files?" question
but you dont need to know where it is to run it
OH.... shouldn't I know the name of the executable? I don't know the name. :(
there's a command that runs it, usually, the name of the program.  if it has multiple words it may or may not have a - in the middle
if you start typing the beginning of the name into the terminal, though, and hit the "tab" key twice, itll list all the possibilities that start with that
thankfully, the terminal has the nice auto-completion feature
Ok.
Yeah. :D
Here is the error. :D "codeblocks: error while loading shared libraries: libwx_gtk2u_aui-2.8.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory".
ok
Let me check to see if I have it.
I don't think I have it, where.
im guessing it means the program is buggy
Do you know another IDE for programming in C?
Eclipse can do C
Yeah... and Eclipse is not so bad. I'll try that.
Eclipse is an IDE for tons of stuff, it's just most popular for Java.  It's really meant to be like Visual Studio though
